ac_template.pptx.report_title: Ayala Corporation Internal Audit Report - Facilities Access Control
ac_template.pptx.executive_summary: To assess physical access provisioning, badge lifecycle management, and visitor controls at corporate locations. Facilities issues badges and manages visitor logs for approximately 2,500 employees and contractors. Review covered access requests, deprovisioning, and visitor registries for Q3–Q4 2025. Audit found delayed badge deactivation and visitor log inconsistencies that increase risk of unauthorized access and safety incidents, prompting recommendations for automation and improved visitor management.
ac_template.pptx.overall_audit_conclusion: The audit identified deficiencies in badge deactivation processes and visitor sign-in controls that increase the risk of unauthorized facility access and safety incidents. Management cooperation was noted; corrective actions are recommended and remediation is ongoing.

details.observation: 12% of terminated employees retained active badges beyond 48 hours in sampled cases.
details.risk: Unauthorized facility access, asset theft, or data exposure.
details.recommendation: Automate deprovisioning via HR-Facilities integration and run daily revocation reports.

details.observation: Visitor sign-in records lacked host verification and printed badge capture for 30% of visits.
details.risk: Unverified access increases risk of unauthorized entry and safety incidents.
details.recommendation: Implement electronic visitor management with host confirmation and badge printing.

recommendations: Automate deprovisioning via HR-Facilities integration and run daily revocation reports.
Implement electronic visitor management with host confirmation and badge printing.
